question: My mother is 77 years old and has been in the hospital 3 times in the last 12 months with pneumonia. She is feeling fine other than the normal aches and pains of an elderly woman. She is on alot of medication and has been for years for diabetes and heart problems. She will wake up early am in a hot sweat and can't speak, just mutters a few words which I can't understand and can't move her body. She is rushed to the hospital and can't breathe. It takes weeks to clear up. What is causing this?
title: Pneumonia in elderly people
